problem_text: 10.12. Does there exist a finitely generated semigroup S with cancellation having non-exponential growth and such that its group of left quotients G = S−1S (which exists) is a group of exponential growth? An affirmative answer would give a positive solution to Problem 12 in (S. Wagon, The Banach–Tarski Paradox, Cambridge Univ. Press, 1985). R. I. Grigorchuk
